moves.1. d4: The start of a queens pawn game
moves.1... d5 2. Nc3: I was planning to go for a giuco piano it this point. But it turned out differently
moves.3. e4: I try to gain more control over the center
moves.3... e6: stasiok plays defensively. The start of a long manoevering
moves.4. Qe2: I take the line of his king. to attack d5 more
moves.4... Bb4: To releave some pressure stasiok attacks my knight(that attacks d5).
moves.5. Bd2: I counter by double covering my knight
moves.5... Bxc3: he's not impressed. after this does take pressure of off d5
moves.6... Na6: not sure what is happening here. Diversion from the center game I would say
moves.7. exd5: I go for his queen pawn
moves.7... cxd5: He takes it leaving a hole on his queen side
moves.8... Ne7 9. Qb5+: first attack on the king. trying to lure him in to Bd7 so I can attack his knight and rook in the a row
moves.10. Qd3: I hastly retreat my daring queen
moves.10... f6: more pressure on the center from king side
moves.11. g3: I start building a house for the king...
moves.11... g5: Taking up my manoeverability but not my strength
moves.12. Bg2: more construction work on the house and secretly preparing to take over the diagonal
moves.12... Nc6: blocking the diagonal and putting some control on my queens pawn
moves.13... Qd6: stasiok is trying to get some control of the queen side (which is mine off course)
moves.14. b4: I emphasize my who's boss here
moves.14... Ne7: stasiok is already changing the center of focus
moves.15. Bb2: I start opening up line c for queen and rook
moves.15... b6 16. O-O: a the house of the king is finished
moves.16... Nc7: totally taking a defensive hold on d5 while im not even attacking...
moves.17. c4: Ok now I im. Im ready to take the center now
moves.19... Qa4: Queen sidelined now... Bad move Stasiok my baseline is well protected as oppossed to yours
moves.20... Ra7: While protectting the knight(s) stasiok is even further weakening his baseline.
moves.21. cxd5: I decide to break center open knowing I got the e line pinned down and a nice combination on c8.
moves.21... Nexd5: stasiok tries to avoid the combination but I still have the diagonal to force him
moves.22. Bxd5: theres the force . He had better taken his loss but no
moves.22... Nxd5: c8 is open with theat of a combination
moves.23. Rxc8+: taking the baseline and his rook. possible changes of getting check mate with Qh7
moves.23... Kf7: fleeing in not necessarily the right direction. but leaving the rook open
moves.24. Rxh8: taking the rook. and the threat of Qh7 gets bigger.
moves.24... f5: so big stasiok decides to remedy it...
moves.25. Rxh7+:
leaving another deadly combination open for my killer rook.
Stasiok  decided to throw in the towel.
